prompt: <description>**Instructions for Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Centered Rectangular Hole** **Step 1: Set up the coordinate system** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.025, 0.0] **Step 2: Create Faces and Loops (2D Sketching)** Create a sketch on the XY plane. Within this sketch, construct two faces and four loops. Face 1: Loop 1: - Create a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0]. - Create a line from point [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.4375]. - Create a line from point [0.75, 0.4375] to [0.0, 0.4375]. - Create a line from point [0.0, 0.4375] to [0.0, 0.0]. Loop 2: - Create a line from point [0.2292, 0.175] to [0.5208, 0.175]. - Create a line from point [0.5208, 0.175] to [0.5208, 0.2625]. - Create a line from point [0.5208, 0.2625] to [0.2292, 0.2625]. - Create a line from point [0.2292, 0.2625] to [0.2292, 0.175]. **Step 3: Create 3D Sketch** Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.025 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.75 **Step 4: Perform Boolean Operation** Perform a NewBodyFeatureOperation to create a new solid body for this extrusion. The dimensions of the final rectangular prism with the centered rectangular hole are: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.025 - Height: 0.75</description>
